# Financial cost-effectiveness {#sec-financial}

This chapter provides a [preliminary analysis]{.underline} of financial cost-effectiveness.

## Pan-European system level {#sec-fin_1}

@fig-figure-4-1 shows that in {{< var doc.year_report >}} the unit ATM/CNS provision costs fell by -34.3% compared to {{< var doc.year_report_minus1 >}}. This is the result of higher traffic in {{< var doc.year_report >}} compared to {{< var doc.year_report_minus1 >}} (58.5%) combined with higher ATM/CNS provision costs (+4.2%).

Comparing with pre-pandemic levels, in {{< var doc.year_report >}} unit ATM/CNS provision costs remain +8.8% higher than in 2019. This mainly reflects the fact that, despite a lower cost-base (-5.5% compared to {{< var doc.year_report_minus2 >}}) traffic volumes in {{< var doc.year_report >}} were still lower than in {{< var doc.year_report_minus2 >}} (-13.2%).
 
::: {#fig-figure-4-1 style="max-width: 470px; margin: auto"}
```{r}

#| out.height: "300px"
#| out.width: "100%"
```

Changes in unit ATM/CNS provision costs, {{< var doc.year_report_minus5 >}} -- {{< var doc.year_report >}} (real terms)
:::

The analytical framework which is used in the ACE analysis to break down the financial cost-effectiveness indicator into relevant economic drivers is presented in @fig-figure-4-2. These key drivers include:

a\) ATCO-hour productivity (0.88 composite flight-hours per ATCO-hour);

b\) ATCO employment costs per ATCO-hour (€132); and,

c\) support costs per unit output (€322).

![ACE performance framework, {{< var doc.year_report >}} (real terms)](figures/Figure-4-2.png){#fig-figure-4-2 width="100%"}

@fig-figure-4-3 shows that in {{< var doc.year_report >}}, ATCO employment costs per ATCO-hour fell by -2.9% while ATCO-hour productivity rose by +45.7%. As a result, ATCO employment costs per composite flight-hour decreased (-33.4%). In the meantime, unit support costs fell by -34.7% due to the combination of an increase in composite flight-hours (+58.5%) and an increase in in support costs (+3.5%). As a result, in 2022, unit ATM/CNS provision costs fell by -34.3% at Pan-European system level.

![Breakdown of changes in unit ATM/CNS provision costs, {{< var doc.year_report_minus1 >}} -- {{< var doc.year_report >}} (real terms)](figures/Figure-4-3.png){#fig-figure-4-3 width="100%"}
